    • Method Detail

      • associatedDictionary

        public boolean associatedDictionary()
        traverse all words word by word in a dictionary and check whether it is found on a cube.
        Returns:
        true if all words in the dictionary were found on a cube.
        false if found 1 word doesn't exist on a cube.

      • isFoundWord

        boolean isFoundWord(java.lang.String word)
        Check a word is found on a cube. Get the first character of the word, search for all possible positions on a cube where this first character is, use Sequential#associatedPoint(Cube, String, int, int, int) to check
        Parameters:
        word -
        Returns:
        true if found the word on a cube.

      • associatedPoint

        private boolean associatedPoint(java.lang.String word,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
        Found a word has the first char at the position (x,y,z), separate the word into an array of chars, check the correspondent of each char of the array with chars on a cube, follow the directions from (x,y,z) to its neighbors.
        To reduce the number of possible directions, we calculate the position (x_lastChar,y_lastChar,z_lastChar) of the last char of the array by the length of word and the direction. If any of (x_lastChar,y_lastChar,z_lastChar) is out of the cube, skip the direction.
        Values of (dirX,dirY,dirZ) are (-1, 0, 1) to calculate the next position (next char).
      • dirX = -1, value of next coordinate x is decreased.
      • dirX = 0, value of next coordinate x is constant.
      • dirX = 1, value of next coordinate x is increased.
Parameters:
cube -
word -
x -
y -
z -
Returns:

  • getCube

    public Cube getCube()
    Returns:
    a cube

  • getDic

    public Dictionary getDic()
    Returns:
    a dictionary

  • invariant

    public boolean invariant()
    check invariant before executing the program. This is NOT invariant when:
  • the length of words in the dictionary is greater than the size of the cube.
  • the cube, the dictionary, or both are NOT invariant
Specified by:
invariant in interface HasInvariant
